titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Account of glass made and sold at the Rensselaer Glass Factory, 1823-1836

publicationstmt.publisher: The New York Public Library. Manuscripts and Archives Division.

address.addressline: Fifth Avenue at 42nd Street, New York, NY 10018-2788

did.unittitle: Account of glass made and sold at the Rensselaer Glass Factory

repository.corpname: The New York Public Library. Manuscripts and Archives Division.

address.addressline: Fifth Avenue at 42nd Street, New York, NY 10018-2788

did.abstract: Rensselaer Glass Factory was located in Rensselaer Village, later Glass House, in town of Sand Lake, Rensselaer Co., N.Y. Account book recording prices, to whom sold, manner of sale, etc., 1823 June 19-1836 Jan. 12. Firms appearing as respective owners include Crandell, Fox & Co.; J.B. Fox & Co.; Knowlson & Schmaass; John B. Schmaass & Co.; and Stadlers, Rush & Co.

bioghist.p: Rensselaer Glass Factory was located in Rensselaer Village, later Glass House, in town of Sand Lake, Rensselaer Co., N.Y.

scopecontent.p: Account book recording prices, to whom sold, manner of sale, etc., 1823 June 19-1836 Jan. 12. Firms appearing as respective owners include Crandell, Fox & Co.; J.B. Fox & Co.; Knowlson & Schmaass; John B. Schmaass & Co.; and Stadlers, Rush & Co.

prefercite.p: Account of glass made and sold at the Rensselaer Glass Factory, Manuscripts and Archives Division, The New York Public Library
